What is the difference between a centripetal force and a centrifugal force?

A) Centripetal force is a force that keeps an object moving in a curved path, while centrifugal force is a force that keeps an object moving in a straight line.
B) Centripetal force is a force that keeps an object moving in a straight line, while centrifugal force is a force that keeps an object moving in a curved path.
C) Centripetal force is a force that pulls an object towards the center of a circle, while centrifugal force is a force that pulls an object away from the center of a circle.
D) Centripetal force is a force that pulls an object away from the center of a circle, while centrifugal force is a force that pulls an object towards the center of a circle.

Which of the above options is correct?

content:
The correct answer is C) Centripetal force is a force that pulls an object towards the center of a circle, while centrifugal force is a force that pulls an object away from the center of a circle.

Centripetal force is a force that keeps an object moving in a curved path, and it is always perpendicular to the radius of the curve. It is the force that keeps the object from flying off in a straight line, and it is what causes the object to follow a curved path. Examples of centripetal forces include the force of gravity on a planet orbiting a star, the force of a car's tires on the road when turning, and the force of a rope on a spinning top.

Centrifugal force, on the other hand, is a force that arises from the rotation of an object around a fixed axis. It is a force that pulls the object away from the center of rotation, and it is always directed away from the center of the circle. Centrifugal force is what causes an object spinning on a string to fly off in a straight line when the string is cut.

So, option C is the correct answer. Options A and B are incorrect because they describe the opposite of the actual definitions of centripetal and centrifugal forces. Option D is also incorrect because it describes a scenario where the centripetal force is pulling the object away from the center of the circle, which is not correct.

B) To separate particles of different sizes
C) To separate particles of different shapes

Answer: A) To separate particles of different densities

A centrifuge is a device that uses centrifugal force to separate particles of different densities. By spinning a mixture of particles at high speed, the particles with a higher density than the solvent will move towards the bottom of the container, while the particles with a lower density will move towards the top. This separation process is commonly used in various fields such as biology, chemistry, and engineering.
